predictions.text: The White House will publicly announce (press release or official statement) a named nominee to be the next Chair of the Federal Reserve Board, by 2026-02-15 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if whitehouse.gov (or an official White House press secretary statement) names a person as the intended/nominated next Fed Chair on or before the deadline; NO otherwise.
evidence: Treasury Secretary Bessent indicated the next Fed chair pick could come next week, raising near-term probability of a formal announcement. https://www.cnbc.com/2026/01/20/bessent-says-trumps-pick-for-the-next-fed-chair-could-happen-next-week.html
monitoring_signals: White House announcements/briefings
WSJ/Reuters reports on Fed chair shortlist
Senate Banking Committee scheduling signals
Fed Board/Chair succession commentary in interviews
predictions.rationale: A specific “next week” hint materially increases odds of an earlier-than-October naming, but timing can slip due to political vetting and market sensitivity.

predictions.text: Denmark will formally request NATO Article 4 consultations explicitly citing Greenland-related security concerns, by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if NATO, Denmark’s government/foreign ministry, or Denmark’s NATO delegation publicly confirms an Article 4 request/consultation tied to Greenland; NO otherwise.
evidence: Greenland acquisition rhetoric is straining NATO ties and includes discussion of possible U.S. military action, increasing likelihood Denmark seeks formal consultations. https://www.cnbc.com/2026/01/21/greenland-us-trump-military-takeover-nato.html
monitoring_signals: NATO press briefings and North Atlantic Council readouts
Danish MFA/PMO statements
Parliament (Folketing) foreign/defense committee agendas
Reuters reporting on NATO consultation mechanisms
predictions.rationale: Escalatory rhetoric raises demand for alliance signaling, but Denmark may avoid Article 4 to reduce escalation and keep negotiations bilateral/EU-centered.

predictions.text: The SPDR S&P 500 ETF (SPY) will close at least 8.0% below its 2026-01-21 close on at least one U.S. trading day, by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Let C0 be SPY’s official close on 2026-01-21. Resolves YES if SPY closes at or below 0.92*C0 on any trading day on/before 2026-03-31; otherwise NO.
evidence: Greenland-related tariff threats and geopolitical shock triggered one of the biggest U.S. stock drops in months and revived a risk-off ‘Sell America’ narrative. https://www.nytimes.com/2026/01/20/business/stocks-trump-greenland-tariffs.html
monitoring_signals: SPY price/volatility (VIX) trend
Headlines on Greenland/tariff implementation steps
Credit spreads (IG/HY) widening
Treasury auction tail metrics and USD moves
predictions.rationale: Elevated geopolitical/tariff uncertainty can extend risk-off, but fast policy de-escalation and buy-the-dip behavior could limit drawdowns.

predictions.text: ICE Brent crude front-month futures will settle at or above $105.00 per barrel on at least one trading day, by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if the ICE Brent front-month contract official settlement price is ≥ 105.00 USD/bbl on any trading day on/before the deadline; otherwise NO.
evidence: Recent market risk repricing shows sensitivity to geopolitical shocks; energy is a typical transmission channel during escalating geopolitical disputes. https://www.cnbc.com/2026/01/20/sell-america-trade-dollar-treasury-gold-us-trump-greenland.html
monitoring_signals: Brent term structure/backwardation
OPEC+ policy statements and compliance
Shipping disruption indicators and insurance premia
U.S. inventory surprises (EIA weekly)
predictions.rationale: A $105 print requires either supply disruption or stronger demand; present risk-off tone lowers baseline probability, but geopolitics can drive spikes.

predictions.text: At least one additional large non-U.S. institutional investor (pension fund, sovereign wealth fund, or insurance company) will publicly announce a plan to sell and/or not reinvest at least $1.0B (USD) in U.S. Treasury securities, by 2026-04-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if a non-U.S. institution publicly states (press release, interview, annual report, or regulatory filing) an intention to reduce U.S. Treasury holdings by ≥$1.0B (or equivalent FX) via sales and/or non-reinvestment by the deadline; otherwise NO.
evidence: A Danish pension fund announced plans to sell $100M of U.S. Treasurys, signaling growing willingness to cite fiscal/political risk when adjusting U.S. rates exposure. https://www.reuters.com/business/danish-pension-fund-divest-its-us-treasuries-2026-01-20/
monitoring_signals: Public statements from major Nordic/EU/Asian pension funds and insurers
Quarterly/annual reports showing Treasury allocation changes
Reuters/Bloomberg stories about ‘Sell America’ positioning
Treasury TIC data for foreign official/private flows
predictions.rationale: One public divestment can catalyze copycat announcements, but most institutions avoid headline risk and may adjust quietly without explicit dollar targets.

predictions.text: Amazon will disclose (in a quarterly shareholder letter, earnings call transcript, or 10-Q) a quantified tariff-related impact of at least $250 million (USD) to cost of sales and/or operating income for a single quarter, by 2026-05-15 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if Amazon explicitly attributes ≥$250M impact (cost increase, margin hit, or operating income reduction) to tariffs in an official quarterly disclosure or call by the deadline; otherwise NO.
evidence: Amazon stated tariffs are starting to ‘creep’ into consumer prices, implying measurable financial impact may soon be disclosed. https://www.cnbc.com/2026/01/20/amazon-jassy-trump-tariffs-prices-shoppers.html
monitoring_signals: Amazon quarterly earnings materials and Q&A
Retail price-index trackers and marketplace fee changes
USTR/CBP tariff implementation timelines
Competitor commentary (WMT/TGT/COST) on tariff pass-through
predictions.rationale: Tariff effects are increasingly salient, but Amazon may avoid a single headline number and instead discuss impacts qualitatively or embedded in broader cost commentary.

predictions.text: A U.S. 10-year Treasury note auction will record a bid-to-cover ratio below 2.20, by 2026-09-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if any U.S. Treasury 10-year note auction (new issue or reopen) has an official bid-to-cover ratio < 2.20 as reported by TreasuryDirect on/before the deadline; otherwise NO.
evidence: Recent headlines show foreign-demand sensitivity and ‘Sell America’ dynamics affecting Treasurys and the dollar, elevating auction-tail risk. https://www.cnbc.com/2026/01/20/sell-america-trade-dollar-treasury-gold-us-trump-greenland.html
A Danish pension fund’s decision to sell Treasurys highlights perception risk around U.S. fiscal outlook. https://www.reuters.com/business/danish-pension-fund-divest-its-us-treasuries-2026-01-20/
monitoring_signals: Auction results: bid-to-cover, tails, indirect bidder share
MOVE index and rate-volatility spikes
Foreign reserve/hedging-cost indicators (FX basis)
Primary dealer balance sheet constraints
predictions.rationale: A single weak auction is plausible under volatility/fiscal-supply pressure, though dealer/indirect participation can remain resilient if yields reprice higher.

predictions.text: The U.S. National Security Agency (NSA) will publish a “CNSA 2.0” (or equivalently titled) suite update specifying post-quantum cryptographic algorithms and a transition timeline for National Security Systems, by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if NSA/CSS publicly releases an official CNSA suite update (or equivalent) that names PQC algorithms and includes dated migration/transition guidance by the deadline; otherwise NO.
evidence: New research highlighting realistic quantum-era risks increases pressure for concrete post-quantum migration planning and standards. https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2026/01/260120000330.htm
monitoring_signals: NSA/CSS cybersecurity advisories and suite publications
NIST PQC standard releases and federal guidance updates
OMB/M-22-09-style zero trust/policy memos referencing PQC
Major vendor PQC roadmap announcements (Microsoft, Google, Apple)
predictions.rationale: PQC transition planning is already underway; formal NSA suite refresh with named algorithms is a likely coordination step, though interagency alignment can delay publication.

predictions.text: OpenAI will update ChatGPT consumer account creation for U.S. users to require an explicit date-of-birth entry and will describe this as an age-gating or age-verification step in a public Help Center/policy update, by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if OpenAI publicly documents (Help Center, policy page, or product announcement) that U.S. ChatGPT signup requires DOB entry and frames it as age gating/verification by the deadline; otherwise NO.
evidence: OpenAI has rolled out an age prediction approach, indicating a move toward stronger youth safety controls that can expand into explicit age gating in product flows. https://openai.com/index/our-approach-to-age-prediction/
monitoring_signals: OpenAI Help Center and policy diffs
App/website signup flow changes observed by users
Regulatory pressure signals (state AG inquiries, FTC commentary)
Competitor youth-safety changes (Google/Meta) influencing norms
predictions.rationale: Safety tooling exists, but converting it into mandatory, explicit consumer signup gates can face usability and privacy tradeoffs, slowing rollout.
